comments.body:
I thought we had no code changes among these?
This will be misleading, as these wont be in the binary, but it will be in the code of the release.
These are code changes to the part of the code which writes the comments for autogenerated files, which in turn show up in the docs. @josh11b, @skye for context.

Correct, this affects the comments of the generated header files in the C++ API. So the binary's header files won't have the updated comments, but the docs and manual builds will.

Are the header files even exposed in the binary? (I'm not exactly sure what kind of binary it is... @keveman told me that the headers files aren't included in the pip install, so does that mean they're not exposed?)
That's right. This shouldn't affect the binary distribution, assuming it is stripped properly.
